meanings.definition: A group of performers, especially actors, who work together.
meanings.sent1: The troupe of actors rehearsed their play together.
meanings.sent2: The circus troupe entertained the audience with their amazing skills.
meanings.sent3: The troupe of clowns made everyone laugh with their silly antics.
meanings.sent4: The troupe of dancers moved in perfect harmony on stage.
meanings.sent5: The troupe of musicians played beautiful music that filled the room.

meanings.definition: To perform as part of a troupe.
meanings.sent1: She will troupe with the theater company for the upcoming show.
meanings.sent2: They troupe together in various cities to showcase their talents.
meanings.sent3: He decided to troupe with the comedy group for a change of pace.
meanings.sent4: The birds troupe in the sky, moving as one graceful unit.
meanings.sent5: The students troupe on stage, each playing their part perfectly.
